Improvement of exclusive breastfeeding practices, adequate and timely complementary feeding, 
along with continued breastfeeding for up to 2 years or beyond, could save the lives of 1.5 million 
children under 5 years of age annually (7). Growth failure during intrauterine life and poor nutrition 
in the first two years of life have critical consequences throughout the life-course. Appropriate 
breastfeeding and complementary feeding practices n
